other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed 74% lymphoid blasts at initial diagnosis and morphologically complete remission six weeks later, with continued complete remission noted three days before the patient's admission for transplantation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial findings showed 74% lymphoid blasts. Six weeks later, the follow-up biopsy showed morphologically complete remission. A third biopsy before transplantation also indicated continued complete remission.

other_tests.findings: Positive results suggesting possible invasive aspergillosis due to high risk factors such as profound neutropenia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two consecutive positive assays were noted.
